chapter: 1 Real-Time Surveillance of Infectious Diseases: A Statistical Perspective
heading: 1 Real-Time Surveillance of Infectious Diseases: A Statistical Perspective
2.1 Short summary
text:
File name:
location: use location_code data location_name_nb_utf results (report, figures)
time generated: add yyyy_mm_dd time day, needed.
File name:location: use location_code data location_name_nb_utf results (report, figures)time generated: add yyyy_mm_dd time day, needed.Task name: name_grouping + name_action + name_variantTask name: name_grouping + name_action + name_variantDatabase (DB) table name: name_access + name_grouping + name_variantDatabase (DB) table name: name_access + name_grouping + name_variantDB table variable name
unified variables
task-specific variables
DB table variable nameunified variablestask-specific variablesThe naming follow rules outlined .

heading: 2.2.1 Language
text: English language code. use English Sykdomspulsen Analytics.Names abbreviations Norwegian kept : data sources msis, dar, sysvak, normomo, locations viken, oslo.example:Task names: oh_import_msis_data, covid19_risk_level_export_maps_msis_cases_countyDatabase table names: anon_covid19_risk_levelsWhether use location name, see section file name.

heading: 2.2.2 Ordering of variables
text: Sometimes variables need ordered. Variables ordered follows:timelocationagesexe.g. database table called msis_by_time_location_age_sex filename called 2020_oslo_05-10_male.xlsx

heading: 2.2.3 Ages
text: Ages always contain least 2 digits joined hyphen (e.g. 05-10).Use 85+ instead >=85.tips help data easily sorted kept right order.

heading: 2.2.4 Capital letters
text: Capital letters avoided whenever possible. also case filenames (e.g. data.rds preferred data.RDS)

heading: 2.3.1 location_code or location_name?
text: Data files: use location_codeWhen saving data files use within Sykdomspulsen Analytics, location_code (e.g. county03) used, county03_05-10_male_2020.rds.Results: use location_nameThis applies figures, tables excel sheets, documents. Use actual location name read people outside Sykdomspulsen team.Use location_name_nb_utf Norwegian Bokmål language UTF-8 encoding. instance 2020_Oslo_fylke_05-10_male.xlsx.can get location_name_nb_utf function fhidata::norway_locations_names()

heading: 2.3.2 When is the file created
text: results (e.g. reports), indicator time files created necessary. allows us find one recent version files names, allows easy tracking Airflow error.e.g. Epidemiologisk_situasjonsrapport_2021_05_31_0659.docx report generated May 31, 2021 06:59 .

heading: 2.4 DB table variables: unified variables
text:
accessible DB tables contain 16 variables.Time conversion functions can found package fhiplot.
Table 2.1:

heading: 2.5 DB table variables: task-specific variables
text:
Task-specific variables commonly referred Tags. tag descriptor row. , identifier data long format. example: tag_outcome, tag_exposure.Variable names contain values one following forms:descriptive_formatdescriptive_format_functiontime
Table 2.2:

heading: 2.5.0.1 Tag descriptive
text: creating database table many different sources data, recommended include data source descriptive:msis_cases_testdate_n - number cases testing datemsis_cases_regdate_n - number cases registration datemsislab_tests_n - number tests performednipar_hospital_main_cause_n - number people admitted hospital covid-19 main causenipar_icu_n - number people admitted ICU covid-19mor_deaths_n - number deaths

heading: 2.5.0.2 Tag format
text: format format value stored .percentages/proportions, recommend using pr100 (.e. values going 0 100) pr1 (.e. values going 0 1).intervals, use XintervalY. recommend:X describing type interval. using frequentist statistics, probably predinterval confinterval. using Bayesian statistics, credinterval appropriate, descriptive determine credible interval describing variable (Bayesian prediction interval) population/distribution parameter (Bayesian confidence interval).Y describes limit, example (percentiles) _p02x5, _p97x5, _p00x1, _p99x9 (z-scores) _l2, _u2, _l4, _u4.examples follows:deaths_n - number deathsdeaths_n_sum0_13 - number deaths occurred today preceeding 13 daysdeaths_pr100000_sum0_13 - number deaths occurred today preceeding 13 days, per 100 00 populationconsultations_r80_vk_ote_n - number influenza consultationsdeaths_registered_n - number deaths registereddeaths_corrected_n - number deaths (corrected registration delay)deaths_corrected_n_credinterval_p02x5 - Bayesian prediction interval “true” number deathsdeaths_corrected_n_credinterval_p97x5 - Bayesian prediction interval “true” number deathsdeaths_corrected_baseline_n - Expected number deaths (.e. baseline)deaths_corrected_baseline_n_credinterval_p02x5 - Bayesian prediction interval expected number death (baseline)deaths_corrected_baseline_n_credinterval_p97x5 - Bayesian prediction interval expected number death (baseline)

heading: 2.5.0.3 Tag functiontime
text: can also include variables refer multiple days/weeks:msis_cases_testdate_n_sum0_13 - aggregate number cases today preceeding 13 days testing datemsis_cases_testdate_pr100000_sum0_13 - aggregate number cases today preceeding 13 days testing date per 100 000 population
